title: Chord: Dominant 7#5 in E (Shape: G)
content:
## Description
The Dominant 7#5 chord can add tension and excitement to your music. It is a variation of the dominant 7 chord with a sharpened fifth. This chord consists of the root note (E), major third (G#), augmented fifth (C), and minor seventh (D).

## Notes and Intervals
- Root: E
- Major third: G#
- Augmented fifth: C
- Minor seventh: D

## Genre and Flavor
The Dominant 7#5 chord is popular in jazz, fusion, and funk music due to its dissonant and unstable sound. It adds a spicy and colorful flavor to compositions, creating tension that can be resolved in interesting ways.

## Songs
1. **"Spain" by Chick Corea** - This jazz fusion classic features the Dominant 7#5 chord in its sophisticated harmonic progressions.
2. **"Come On, Come Over" by Jaco Pastorius** - This funk track incorporates the Dominant 7#5 chord in its groovy basslines and chordal arrangements.
3. **"Punk Jazz" by Weather Report** - A fusion piece that showcases the versatility of the Dominant 7#5 chord in a dynamic and eclectic musical setting.
